item.title: Welcome Danielle Westmark, our IPI Fellow!

item.description:
Danielle is a student in the Inter-professional Informationist (IPI) Program at Simmons University and will be working with Ariel and the Data Science team from Jan-May 2021 as part of her capstone project. Danielle is looking to build on her knowledge of research data management, data science, and reproducibility and ...

item.title: Building Data Skills in California Libraries
item.dc:creator: Ariel Deardorff
item.description:
Ariel shares about a project she worked on this year with the nonprofit organization The Carpentries From Jan to Sept of this year 20% of my time was dedicated to a grant-funded project with The Carpentries, a global non-profit dedicated to teaching data and software skills to researchers and librarians. ...

item.title: Introducing the 2020 Library Open Research Challenge!
item.dc:creator: Ariel Deardorff
item.description:
Are you planning on publishing an article, giving a talk, or designing a class this year? Why not participate in the 2020 library open research challenge and publish in an open access journal, deposit your presentation in eScholarship, or make your class materials freely available on the CLE! The goal ...

item.title: Recapping the Library Education Retreat
item.dc:creator: Ariel Deardorff
item.description:
Last Friday a group of Library staff gathered together for the first Library Education retreat. The retreat was geared towards educators in the library (as opposed to those involved in designing educational tools and systems) and was part of the “Learn with the Library” marquee project.
